Protecting the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15) are the stern and resolute guardians of the dead known as vanths, psychopomps who resemble skeletons with raven-like wings and a mask resembling a vulture's skull. Vanths carry black scythes to fight against those who would disturb the natural progression of souls, and they consider any visitor to the Boneyard a potential troublemaker. When the psychopomp armies go to war, vanths serve as front-line soldiers. They rarely speak and even more rarely show any emotion other than a grim adherence to duty. **[Recall Knowledge - Monitor](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 23 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 [Vanth](/Monsters.aspx?ID=769) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 210 2.0 **Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [lifesense 60 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Requian](/Languages.aspx?ID=34) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +17, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +17, [Boneyard Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +15, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +13, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +17 **Str** +6 **Dex** +4 **Con** +2 **Int** +2 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +2 **Items** [_+1 scythe_](/Weapons.aspx?ID=39) --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +15 **Ref** +13 **Will** +17 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 105 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46) **Resistances** negative 10, poison 10 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 20 feet, DC 22
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** scythe +18 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 1d10+8 slashing plus spirit touch **Melee** jaws +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 1d6+8 slashing plus spirit touch **Divine Innate Spells** DC 22 - **2nd** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (at will; self only) - **3rd** [Locate](/Spells.aspx?ID=173) (×3), [Searing Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=269) (×3) - **4th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will) - **5th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) **Infuse Weapon** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) A vanth's scythe is its symbol of office and gains a measure of its personal power. This scythe becomes a _+1 scythe_ and is treated as if it were [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374) while the vanth wields it. A vanth whose scythe is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work. **Spirit Touch** An vanth's Strikes affect [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) creatures with the effects of a [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) property rune and deal 2d6 negative damage to living creatures and 2d6 positive damage to undead. **Vanth's Curse** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110)) **Frequency** three times per day; **Effect** The vanth bestows a curse on a creature by touching it with its scythe. The creature must attempt a DC 25 Will save.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Vanth's Curse for 24 hours.
**Success** The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.
**Failure** The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is stupefied 2. Each time the target gains the [dying](/Conditions.aspx?ID=11) condition, the stupefied condition value increases by 1, to a maximum value of stupefied 4.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the effect is permanent.
Vanth Scythes Vanths' favored weapon is the [scythe](/Weapons.aspx?ID=39), a choice that even further adds to their fearsome appearance and can lead to unfortunate associations with the [Grim Reaper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=250) or [Urgathoa](/Deities.aspx?ID=19) among more superstitious mortals. Vanths find such comparisons to be ignorant at best or insulting at worst. Some vanths infuse their scythes with different qualities, such as [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) or [silver](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379), depending on the nature of their most common enemies.
